elementSpec.desc: contains a date in any format.

attDef.desc: indicates the system or calendar to which the date belongs.

exemplum.egXML: He was born on Feb. 22, 1732 ( Feb. 11, 1731/32, O.S.).

attDef.desc: gives the value of the date in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.
attDef.valDesc: A string representing a date in standard format as defined in XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes Second Edition, except that times may be expressed with reduced precision (i.e., to the minute or the hour). Software intended for use with W3C XML Schema datatypes may be unable to properly process times expressed with reduced precision.

exemplum.egXML: This list begins in the year 1632, more precisely on Trinity Sunday, i.e. the Sunday after Pentecost, in that year the 27th of May (old style).

remarks.p: The value of value is constrained to be in one of the date formats recognized by the W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes specification, except that times may be expressed with reduced precision. This is true whether the date is a Gregorian or a proleptic Gregorian date.
Note that the allowable values of value are the same as those for the value attribute of the time element.

attDef.desc: indicates the degree of precision associated with the date.

valItem.gloss: the date is precise to the smallest unit specified by its value attribute
the date is of low precision

exemplum.egXML: Given on the Twelfth Day of June in the Year of Our Lord One Thousand Nine Hundred and Seventy-seven of the Republic the Two Hundredth and first and of the University the Eighty-Sixth.
